tooltip: remove primers sequences from the reads

extraInputs.name: cores
extraInputs.tooltip: number of cores to use. For paired-end data in fasta format, set to 1 [default]. For fastq formats you may set the value to 0 to use all cores

extraInputs.name: no_indels
extraInputs.tooltip: do not allow insertions or deletions is primer search. Mismatches are the only type of errors accounted in the error rate parameter.

Inputs.name: forward_primers
Inputs.tooltip: specify forward primer (5'-3'); add up to 13 primers

Inputs.name: reverse_primers
Inputs.tooltip: specify reverse primer (3'-5'); add up to 13 primers

Inputs.name: mismatches
Inputs.tooltip: allowed mismatches in the primer search

Inputs.name: min_overlap
Inputs.tooltip: number of overlap bases with the primer sequence. Partial matches are allowed, but short matches may occur by chance, leading to erroneously clipped bases. Specifying higher overlap than the length of primer sequnce will still clip the primer (e.g. primer length is 22 bp, but overlap is specified as 25 - this does not affect the identification and clipping of the primer as long as the match is in the specified mismatch error range)

Inputs.name: seqs_to_keep
Inputs.tooltip: 'keep_all' keeps the sequences where at least one primer was found (fwd or rev); recommended when cutting primers from paired-end data (unassembled), where individual R1 or R2 read lenghts are shorther than the expected amplicon length. 'keep_only_linked' = keep sequences if primers are found in both ends (fwdâ€¦rev); discards the read if both primers were not found in this read; maybe useful for single-end data

Inputs.name: pair_filter
Inputs.tooltip: applies only for paired-end data. Option 'both' discards a read-pair when both reads do not contain a primer sequence. Option 'any' discards the read-pair when one of the reads does not contain a primer sequence

Inputs.name: read_R1
Inputs.tooltip: [only for paired-end data] identifyer string that is common for all R1 reads. R1/R2 reads must contain R1/R2 strings in the file names; sample names must not contain R1/R2! (e.g. when all R1 files have '.R1' string, then enter '\.R1'. Note that backslash is only needed to escape dot regex; e.g. when all R1 files have '_R1' string, then enter '_R1'.)

Inputs.name: read_R2
Inputs.tooltip: [only for paired-end data] identifyer string that is common for all R2 reads (e.g. when all R2 files have '.R2' string, then enter '\.R2'. Note that backslash is only needed to escape dot regex; e.g. when all R2 files have '_R1' string, then enter '_R2'.)

Inputs.name: maxEE
Inputs.tooltip: discard sequences with more than the specified number of expected errors

Inputs.name: maxN
Inputs.tooltip: discard sequences with more than the specified number of Ns (ambiguous bases)

Inputs.name: minLen
Inputs.tooltip: remove reads with length less than minLen. minLen is enforced after all other trimming and truncation

Inputs.name: truncQ
Inputs.tooltip: truncate reads at the first instance of a quality score less than or equal to truncQ

Inputs.name: truncLen
Inputs.tooltip: truncate reads after truncLen bases (applies to R1 reads when working with paired-end data). Reads shorter than this are discarded. Explore quality profiles (with QualityCheck module) see whether poor quality ends needs to truncated

Inputs.name: truncLen_R2
Inputs.tooltip: truncate R2 reads after truncLen bases. Reads shorter than this are discarded. Explore quality profiles (with QualityCheck module) see whether poor quality ends needs to truncated

Inputs.name: maxLen
Inputs.tooltip: remove reads with length greater than maxLen. maxLen is enforced on the raw reads. In dada2, the default = Inf, but here set as 9999

Inputs.name: minQ
Inputs.tooltip: after truncation, reads contain a quality score below minQ will be discarded

Inputs.name: matchIDs
Inputs.tooltip: applies only for paired-end data. If TRUE, then double-checking (with seqkit pair) that only paired reads that share ids are outputted

tooltip: select the denoising options for DADA2 'dada' function

extraInputs.name: BAND_SIZE
extraInputs.tooltip: default = 16 for loessErrfun and 32 for PacBioErrfun. Banding for Needleman-Wunsch alignments.

extraInputs.name: OMEGA_A
extraInputs.tooltip: default = 1e-40. Denoising setting; see DADA2 'setDadaOpt()' for detalis. Default value  is a conservative setting to avoid making false positive inferences, but comes at the cost of reducing the ability to identify some rare variants

extraInputs.name: OMEGA_P
extraInputs.tooltip: default = 1e-4 (0.0001). Denoising setting; see DADA2 'setDadaOpt()' for detalis

extraInputs.name: OMEGA_C
extraInputs.tooltip: default = 1e-40. Denoising setting; see DADA2 'setDadaOpt()' for detalis

extraInputs.name: DETECT_SINGLETONS
extraInputs.tooltip: Default = FALSE. Denoising setting; see DADA2 'setDadaOpt()' for detalis. If set to TRUE, this removes the requirement for at least two reads with the same sequences to exist in order for a new ASV to be detected

Inputs.name: errorEstFun
Inputs.tooltip: DADA2 errorEstimationFunction. 'loessErrfun' for Illumina data; 'PacBioErrfun' for PacBio data

Inputs.name: pool
Inputs.tooltip: if pool = TRUE, the algorithm will pool together all samples prior to sample inference. Pooling improves the detection of rare variants, but is computationally more expensive. If pool = 'pseudo', the algorithm will perform pseudo-pooling between individually processed samples. This argument has no effect if only 1 sample is provided, and pool does not affect error rates, which are always estimated from pooled observations across samples

Inputs.name: qualityType
Inputs.tooltip: Auto means to attempt to auto-detect the fastq quality encoding. This may fail for PacBio files with uniformly high quality scores, in which case use 'FastqQuality'

tooltip: assemble paired-end reads (R1 and R2) with DADA2 'mergePairs' function

Inputs.name: minOverlap
Inputs.tooltip: the minimum length of the overlap required for merging the forward and reverse reads

Inputs.name: maxMismatch
Inputs.tooltip: the maximum mismatches allowed in the overlap region

Inputs.name: trimOverhang
Inputs.tooltip: if TRUE, overhangs in the alignment between the forwards and reverse read are trimmed off. Overhangs are when the reverse read extends past the start of the forward read, and vice-versa, as can happen when reads are longer than the amplicon and read into the other-direction primer region

Inputs.name: justConcatenate
Inputs.tooltip: if TRUE, the forward and reverse-complemented reverse read are concatenated rather than merged, with a NNNNNNNNNN (10 Ns) spacer inserted between them

Inputs.name: method
Inputs.tooltip: 'consensus' - the samples are independently checked for chimeras, and a consensus decision on each sequence variant is made. If 'pooled', the samples are all pooled together for chimera identification. If 'per-sample', the samples are independently checked for chimeras

tooltip: Collaplse identical ASVs or/and filter ASVs by length

extraInputs.name: minOverlap
extraInputs.tooltip: collapseNoMismatch setting. Default = 20. The minimum overlap of base pairs between ASV sequences required to collapse them together

extraInputs.name: vec
extraInputs.tooltip: collapseNoMismatch setting. Default = TRUE. Use the vectorized aligner. Should be turned off if sequences exceed 2kb in length

Inputs.name: collapseNoMismatch
Inputs.tooltip: collapses ASVs that are identical up to shifts or length variation, i.e. that have no mismatches or internal indels (dada2 'collapseNoMismatch')

Inputs.name: by_length
Inputs.tooltip: discard ASVs from the ASV table that are shorter than specified value (in base pairs). Value 0 means OFF, no filtering by length

tooltip: assign taxonomy with DADA2 'assignTaxonomy' function against a selected database. Untick the checkbox to skip this step

Inputs.name: dada2_database
Inputs.tooltip: Select a reference database fasta file for taxonomy annotation. Click on the header to download DADA2-formatted reference databases https://benjjneb.github.io/dada2/training.html

Inputs.name: minBoot
Inputs.tooltip: the minimum bootstrap confidence for assigning a taxonomic level

Inputs.name: tryRC
Inputs.tooltip: the reverse-complement of each sequences will be used for classification if it is a better match to the reference sequences than the forward sequence
